displaytitle: Six Studies of Draped Figures, Including Pallas Athena and a Caduceus
medium: Pen and yellow-brown ink on light tan paper; verso: red chalk squared in black chalk on light tan paper
creditline: Gift of Emily Townsend Vermeule, honorary degree holder of the Class of 1989, and Cornelius Clarkson Vermeule III, in memory of Alphaeus Hyatt Mayor, Class of 1922, George Rodney Meneely, Class of 1933, and Cornelius Clarkson Vermeule Jr., Class of 1917
inscribed: Inscribed verso, center, in graphite: Parmigianino

titles.title: Six Studies of Draped Figures, Including Pallas Athena and a Caduceus

makers.displaymaker: follower of Girolamo da Carpi, Ferrara 1501–1556 Ferrara

caption: Follower of Girolamo da Carpi (Ferrara 1501–1556 Ferrara), Six Studies of Draped Figures, Including Pallas Athena and a Caduceus, ca. 1530. Pen and yellow-brown ink on light tan paper; verso: red chalk squared in black chalk on light tan paper; 21.3 × 17.2 cm. Gift of Emily Townsend Vermeule, honorary degree holder of the Class of 1989, and Cornelius Clarkson Vermeule III, in memory of Alphaeus Hyatt Mayor, Class of 1922, George Rodney Meneely, Class of 1933, and Cornelius Clarkson Vermeule Jr., Class of 1917 (1997-566)
